author: soryaek
message: feat(curriculum): add additional steps in cat blog workshop (#59263)

files.patch:
@@ -7,14 +7,12 @@ dashedName: step-21 # --description-- -For the final step, you will need to add the phone number and email address for the blog author. +For this step, you will need to add the phone number and email address for the blog author. Inside the `address` element, add a paragraph element with the text of `Phone: 555-555-5555`. Below that paragraph element, add another paragraph element with the text of `Email: fake@email.com`. -And with those changes, your blog page is now complete. - # --hints-- You should have two `p` elements inside your `address` element. @@ -143,102 +141,3 @@ assert.strictEqual(pElement?.innerText, 'Email: fake@email.com'); ``` -# --solutions-- - -```html - - - - Mr. Whiskers' Blog - - - -

@@ -0,0 +1,149 @@ +--- +id: 67d1edfde28a4133ba64ad26 +title: Step 22 +challengeType: 0 +dashedName: step-22 +--- + +# --description-- + +To improve user experience, you will want to enhance the phone number so that users tap on it and initiate a call. + +Here is how you can make phone numbers clickable: + +```html +234-567-8912 +``` + +Wrap the text `555-555-5555` in an anchor element and use `tel:` to make it a clickable phone number. + +# --hints-- + +You should wrap the text `555-555-5555` in an `a` element. + +```js +const firstPElement = document.querySelector('footer #contact address p:nth-of-type(1)'); +const link = firstPElement.querySelector('a'); +assert.exists(link); +assert.strictEqual(link.textContent, "555-555-5555"); +``` + +Your `a` element should have an `href` attribute. + +```js +const firstPElement = document.querySelector('footer #contact address p:nth-of-type(1)'); +const link = firstPElement.querySelector('a'); +assert.exists(link.getAttribute('href')); +``` + +The `href` attribute for your new `a` element should be set to `tel:5555555555`. + +```js +const firstPElement = document.querySelector('footer #contact address p:nth-of-type(1)'); +const link = firstPElement.querySelector('a'); +assert.strictEqual(link.getAttribute('href'), "tel:5555555555"); +``` + +# --seed-- + +## --seed-contents-- + +```html + + + + Mr. Whiskers' Blog + + + +
+

@@ -0,0 +1,251 @@ +--- +id: 67d1f348f2cc9eab9d0b4ff4 +title: Step 23 +challengeType: 0 +dashedName: step-23 +--- + +# --description-- + +Similarly, users should be able to click on the email address and send an email from their default email client. + +Here is how you can make email addresses clickable: + +```html +contact@company.com +``` + +For this final step, wrap the text `fake@email.com` in an anchor element and use `mailto:` to make it a clickable email address. + +And with those changes, your blog page is now complete. + +# --hints-- + +You should wrap the text `fake@email.com` in an `a` element. + +```js +const secondPElement = document.querySelector('footer #contact address p:nth-of-type(2)'); +const link = secondPElement.querySelector('a'); +assert.exists(link); +assert.strictEqual(link.textContent, "fake@email.com"); +``` + +Your `a` element should have an `href` attribute. + +```js +const secondPElement = document.querySelector('footer #contact address p:nth-of-type(2)'); +const link = secondPElement.querySelector('a'); +assert.exists(link.getAttribute('href')); +``` + +The `href` attribute for your new `a` element should be set to `mailto:fake@email.com`. + +```js +const secondPElement = document.querySelector('footer #contact address p:nth-of-type(2)'); +const link = secondPElement.querySelector('a'); +assert.strictEqual(link.getAttribute('href'), "mailto:fake@email.com"); +``` + +# --seed-- + +## --seed-contents-- + +```html + + + + Mr. Whiskers' Blog + + + +
+
